title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Amazon plans to open several large physical retail locations in the U.S. that will operate akin to department stores, a step to help the company extend its reach.

---

The FTC filed a new version of its antitrust lawsuit against Facebook, seeking to jump-start its case.

---

Toyota said it would cut production in Japan by 40% in September because of a semiconductor shortage.

---

Intel CEO Gelsinger said he is committed to buying other chip makers as the industry consolidates.

---

Pfizer and Moderna are on track to notch billions more in sales than previously expected.

---

J&J's Gorsky will step aside as CEO, handing the reins to longtime lieutenant Duato effective Jan. 3.

---

Huarong, China's top manager of distressed assets, said it would post a massive loss and expects to receive a capital infusion.

---

Macy's, Kohl's and Coach parent Tapestry reported big quarterly sales gains.

---

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq both closed 0.1% higher after a choppy session. The Dow declined 0.2%.

---

Goldman said it agreed to acquire the money-management operation of Dutch insurer NN Group for about $1.87 billion.

---

In a reordering of the trading-card world, unions representing players in MLB, the NBA and the NFL have struck deals with a new company controlled by Fanatics.
